benchmark_details.name: Mobile-Bench: An Evaluation Benchmark for LLM-based Mobile Agents
benchmark_details.overview: Mobile-Bench is a novel benchmark for evaluating the capabilities of LLM-based mobile agents, providing a dataset of 832 entries and over 200 tasks designed for multi-APP collaboration scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for LLM-based mobile agents, assessing their planning, reasoning, and interaction capabilities in real-world mobile environments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The Mobile-Bench may struggle with general large models which exhibit pronounced illusions in API calls.

data.source: Real user queries combined with generated data from LLMs.
data.annotation: Mixed: real data from user queries and generated tasks through GPT-4.

methodology.calculation: CheckPoint coverage is calculated as the weighted sum of the scores based on package usage, key phrases, and API calls.
methodology.interpretation: Interpretation revolves around determining the ability of the LLM-based agents to navigate and complete tasks in the predefined mobile environment.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance results based on LLMs like GPT-3.5 and GPT-4, showing variations in PassRate across task types.
methodology.validation: Quality verification processes include cross-source validation of user-generated and GPT-4 generated tasks.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Privacy measures are in place, focusing on de-identification of user data collected.
